item.title: Fall Guys: How To Piggyback
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Is The Piggyback Feature In Fall Guys?
  • How Do You Do A Piggyback In Fall Guys?
  • How Do You Cancel A Piggyback In Fall Guys?

Piggyback is a fairly new feature in Fall Guys , which might need to be clarified for some returning or new players. The premise is simple: hop on another player’s back or let them hop on yours and carry each other to the finish line. However, in practice, this feature might not feel instinctive — especially now that you have to press an Emote button to request and accept Piggybacks.

The following guide aims to compensate for the lack of in-game instructions on Piggybacks in Fall Guys by explaining what the feature is and how you can use it, as well as offering some extra information about this fun mechanic.

What Is The Piggyback Feature In Fall Guys?

Piggyback is a social feature in Fall Guys that allows you to carry another player on your back . Introduced with the Fall Forever update in April 2024, this feature is part of the new gameplay changes. Piggybacking requires mutual agreement between two players. You can only pick up or be carried by another player if both parties have accepted the request.

Piggyback was introduced alongside a few other new gameplay features, like the Phrase and Emote Wheel, added with the May 2024 update. However, it was the only feature that did not face major backlash . Most other Fall Forever additions were labeled game-breaking by the community.

How Do You Do A Piggyback In Fall Guys?

On PlayStation and Xbox, you can request or accept a Piggyback by pressing up on the D-pad . On PC, you’ll need to press the 'H' key. Mobile users, however, simply need to tap the dedicated Piggyback button located in the top-right corner of the screen (look for the icon showing two Beans ).

Piggyback Buttons On Different Platforms

Platform

Piggyback Buttons

PlayStation and Xbox

Up on the D-pad

PC

'H' key

Mobile

The Piggyback button (top-right corner)

Your Piggyback request is automatically removed when you grab and dive or get knocked out.

You can change the Piggyback button by going to the settings and rearranging the key binds. (If you’re not planning to use it often, set it on a button you rarely press.)

When you request a Piggyback, a pinkish icon pops up on your head. When you’re eligible to accept another player’s Piggyback request, the same icon will appear, but it will turn blue.

How Do You Cancel A Piggyback In Fall Guys?

Pressing the Piggyback button while carrying someone or being carried by others will cancel the mode. You also drop your piggybacked partner whenever you use power-ups. However, you can still grab items and throw stuff without losing the bond with the player you’re carrying.

Both players involved in a Piggyback can cancel it anytime they want.

While Piggybacking another player, Emotes become unavailable . However, you will still be able to use the Phrase Wheel.

item.title: Every Pokemon Game On The Gamecube, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Pokemon Box: Ruby & Sapphire is an outdated storage system. Avoid revisiting it.
  • Pokemon Channel offers unique charm with TV channels dedicated to Pokemon. Worth a revisit for fans.
  • Pokemon XD: Gale of Darkness provides a story-driven experience with Shadow Pokemon. A unique and worthy playthrough.

The main series of Pokemon games has always been handheld-exclusive, up until the release of the Nintendo Switch. While players on handheld were gifted with enthralling and engaging RPG adventures, home console players would also receive Pokemon games, albeit in a very different form.

GameCube is no exception. Throughout the system's lifespan, Nintendo released four Pokemon games, all of which were compatible with third-generation Pokemon games released on Game Boy Advance. The GameCube was also the first home system to receive Pokemon RPG games, which, however, were very different from the main series titles. With that in mind, which Pokemon games were the best on Gamecube?

Updated August 22, 2024 by Ben Painter : Traditionally, Pokemon was always a handheld console series, but several spin-off games were introduced on consoles like the Nintendo 64 and the GameCube, which were not a part of the mainline run of Pokemon games. This is a trend that has continued to this day with Pokemon Snap , Pokken Tournament DX , and Detective Pikachu Returns available on the Nintendo Switch.

Some of these home console titles were well-received, while offers were shunned, never to be played again. This update adds detail to each entry stating how much each game is today and where it can be purchased.

4 Pokemon Box: Ruby And Sapphire

A Storage System For Hoenn Games

The worst Pokemon game on the GameCube is undoubtedly Pokemon Box: Ruby and Sapphire . The reason is very simple: this is barely a game. In fact, it's nothing more than a storage system for mainline third-generation Pokemon games. Players could upload and store their Pokemon from other games in Pokemon Box . To be fair, there are some additional features, such as having Pokemon breed, but that doesn't take away from the fact that this is nothing more than a storage system. This is easily one of the worst spin-off ideas of all time, even if applications like Pokemon Bank and Pokemon Home could be seen as successors to this original concept.

While originally released with Pokemon Ruby & Sapphire in mind, as the title suggests, the game is also compatible with Pokemon Emerald and Pokemon FireRed & LeafGreen , so every third-generation mainline game can upload creatures on Pokemon Box . This allows players to transfer between those games without needing two Game Boy Advance and a Game Boy Advance Link Cable, which many players don't have today. Despite its abysmal reputation, the game has become increasingly rare over time and is now very difficult to come by at a reasonable price.

Is Pokemon Box: Ruby & Sapphire Worth Revisiting Today?

Definitely not. At the time, the game was seen as revolutionary. When starting a new game on Pokemon Ruby, Sapphire, Emerald, FireRed or LeafGreen, the entire game would be reset, essentially wiping all Pokemon from the game. Pokemon Box allowed Pokemon to be kept. Perfect for completing the Pokedex, as certain Pokemon could only be caught on one save file; the starter Pokemon, for example. But this is just not necessary anymore. Pokemon Home has this exact same feature but is available for modern Pokemon games like the latest entry, Pokemon Scarlet & Violet . To summarize, Pokemon Box: Ruby & Sapphire is completely outdated.

How Much Is Pokemon Box: Ruby & Sapphire Today?

Most Pokemon games in this era are worth almost four times as much as they were at the time of their original release. Gamers will be looking to pay around $150-$250 to pick up a copy of Pokemon Box: Ruby & Sapphire . It can be found on websites like eBay for an unsealed copy. For a sealed copy of the game, fans are looking at paying around $1000-$2000, which is very unreasonable, especially considering this game has no replay value whatsoever.

3 Pokemon Channel

Terrible Gameplay But A Fun Little Concept

Pokemon Channel is one of the weirdest spin-offs in the franchise, and it's partially a spiritual successor to Hey You, Pikachu! on Nintendo 64. The game is very simple in structure yet difficult to explain in a few words. Basically, players are tasked with being beta testers for new TV channels dedicated to Pokemon . Players will need to surf through various channels to report feedback to Professor Oak, but they will also be able to explore the house they are in and some outdoor areas.

While the game is very short on content and there's arguably very little to play, it still has a unique charm. Watching Pokemon TV is an oddly fascinating and charming experience, and while this is surely a far cry from the epic adventures of the mainline games, it's still a decent distraction, especially for kids, who were the game's main target. Also, the game provides one of the ways to get a legitimate Jirachi, which players can download on Pokemon Ruby & Sapphire upon beating the game.

Is Pokemon Channel Worth Revisiting Today?

Sort of, if players are looking for engaging or challenging gameplay, then the answer is no. Pokemon Channe l does have a certain charm to it. Seeing Pokemon become news anchors or shopping channel hosts is certainly something that all Pokemon fans should witness. Ultimately, this game could be missed for gamers looking to play through all of the Pokemon games, as there isn't much that this GameCube title adds to the overall massive picture of the Pokemon franchise. As spinoff games go, there are modern entries that could be explored instead. Pokemon Cafe ReMix , Pokemon Go , and Pokemon Masters EX all have more playability than this game.

How Much Is Pokemon Channel Today?

For preowned versions of the game, Pokemon fans will be looking to pay around $20-$70. Prices are extremely varied from different sellers. Sealed versions of the game are $150+, which is a fairer price than Pokemon Box: Ruby & Sapphire , if collectors are looking for the older Pokemon games then Pokemon Channel is a very cheap option to pick up compared to others. eBay is a great place to look for this game as there are a few on there.

2 Pokemon XD: Gale Of Darkness

Not As Strong As A Story As Its Predecessor

Pokemon XD: Gale of Darkness is the second Pokemon RPG released on Gamecube. The game is set some years after the events of Pokemon Colosseum , and players are once again tasked with defeating Team Cypher, which is transforming Pokemon into Shadow Pokemon by corrupting their hearts. The game is set some years after the events of the previous game and is probably the closest thing to a mainline Pokemon experience on the Gamecube.

However, the game still feels very different from mainline games, as the game's focus is more on the narrative rather than the collecting and training side of things. Also, while Pokemon XD provides many quality-of-life improvements over its predecessor, it arguably has a weaker plot, and this is what makes the game only the second best on Gamecube. Despite this, every Pokemon fan should try and give it a go, even if it won't be easy because the game is still trapped on the Gamecube.

Is Pokemon XD: Gale Of Darkness Worth Revisiting Today?

Definitely, this game offers a very unique experience unlike any other Pokemon game. This story-driven mode does not focus on collecting Pokemon and completing the Pokedex like the mainline games. Shadow Pokemon are an amazing concept that is all but exclusive to this game, apart from Pokemon GO , so it is a great way to see them in their full glory. Shadow Lugia is iconic. For this alone, it is worth a playthrough. Good luck tracking down a copy of this game, as they are hard to find, and the game is still trapped on the GameCube console. Something similar that is more easily found is Pokemon Legends: Arceus , or maybe even the Pokemon Mystery Dungeon franchise.

How Much Is Pokemon XD: Gale Of Darkness Today?

For sealed and mint condition copies of this GameCube title, fans will be looking at paying over a thousand dollars. At this price, it is not worth it. However, for a version of the game that has been played before, gamers are looking at a more reasonable price of around $70-$150. Considering this game is fairly iconic with the Shadow Lugia that is a fair price for an almost 20-year-old title. Again, eBay seems to be the best place to pick up Pokemon XD: Gale Of Darkness .

1 Pokemon Colosseum

Amazing Gameplay And 3D Pokemon Battles

Pokemon Colosseum is the best Pokemon game on the Gamecube and an experience that every Pokemon fan should play through. The game was the first Pokemon RPG on a home system, which was revolutionary at the time. The main campaign has a darker and grittier plot when compared to the series' standards, something that adds a unique charm to this adventure. Players are also able to trade Pokemon with all third-generation games, allowing for their favorites to appear in the game and help them out in beating the main story.

Other than that, the game also provides a battle mode, which allows players to focus on battles, rendered in beautiful Gamecube graphics. It's not much by today's standards, but at the time players had never seen such high-quality Pokemon battles. Also, the game included notable bonuses at launch: Japanese players got a bonus disc that allowed them to download Celebi on mainline games, while US players got an exclusive Jirachi. Because of all this, many players are asking for a remake of the game, or at least for it to be re-released on the Nintendo Switch Online platform.

Is Pokemon Colosseum Worth Revisiting Today?

Yes, Pokemon Colosseum has held up to this day as a way for players to experience 3D Pokemon Battles. Although this is now the norm in the franchise, it is awesome to go back and see the first time this happened in the Pokemon games. It is tricky to be able to play this game legitimately, as it is only available on the GameCube. As such, alternatives are Pokemon Battle Revolution on the Wii, or even the mainline Pokemon games on the Nintendo Switch, which have a very similar style to Pokemon Colosseum's battles.

How Much Is Pokemon Colosseum Today?

The cheapest option on this list, and it so happens to be the best entry too. Pokemon Colosseum is priced at around $35-$40 which is an absolute steal and a price that even casual Pokemon fans could be looking at paying. Sealed versions range from $ 500 to $1000, though only hardcore collectors should look at paying that price. eBay looks to be the best and cheapest place to pick up Colosseum, and for the price it currently is, it would be worth picking up.​​​​​​​

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Pyramid Head Figure Makes The Monster Adorable
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Silent Hill 2 fans have a lot to look forward to with the upcoming Nendoroid figure of Pyramid Head, turning the monster into an adorable chibi version.
  • Despite some hesitations about the upcoming remake, Pyramid Head remains iconic and is a must-have for fans eager to recreate memorable scenes from the game.
  • The pre-sale phase for the Pyramid Head Nendoroid is in full swing, offering fans the chance to snag this articulated figure before its release in Quarter 2 of 2025.

Silent Hill 2 's Pyramid Head is getting an articulated Nendoroid figure that makes the horrifying monster adorable instead. This Silent Hill 2 Nendoroid is one of the latest pieces of merchandise to be revealed for the game.

Silent Hill 2 has a lot of gamers' attention right now due to the remake that's rapidly approaching its release date. While many fans are hesitant about the remake, it's brought both versions of the game to the front of gamers' minds. Of course, Silent Hill 2 wouldn't be complete without the legendary Pyramid Head or Red Pyramid Thing monster, which terrorizes James Sunderland throughout his journey in the spooky town.

Now, Pyramid Head is getting a Nendoroid action figure that turns it into a chibi-style version of itself. Like with all Nendoroids, Pyramid Head has been shrunk down to just a few inches tall, looking short and squashy instead of having its usual lanky build in Silent Hill 2 . The Pyramid Head Nendoroid, like other game Nendoroid releases, is articulated, allowing fans to pose Pyramid Head in iconic poses, like it skewering itself during a certain boss battle. It also includes both its Great Knife and Spear, and can hold either weapon for recreating memorable scenes from the game.

At the time of writing, Pyramid Head's Nendoroid is currently in the pre-sale phase, going for $41.99 from manufacturer Good Smile before shipping. It's not slated to release until Quarter 2 of 2025, so fans will need to wait a while to get their hands on it. Barring any last-minute complications, this also means that the Nendoroid will ship quite a while after the Silent Hill 2 remake releases.

Pyramid Head Remains Iconic

Although the creator of the monster seemingly regrets creating Pyramid Head, the terrifying creature is arguably the most-recognized thing to emerge from the entire series. The renown and popularity of Pyramid Head led to it appearing in subsequent entries like Silent Hill: Homecoming , and even the two Silent Hill movies released thus far. It will presumably also play a big role in the third Silent Hill film, which will be based off the second game. The terror of being defenseless against Pyramid Head while playing Silent Hill 2 has made it memorable, as well as the striking appearance that stands out even among the creepy Bubble Head Nurses.

Since the original Silent Hill 2 launched so long ago, latecomers to the series haven't had much of an opportunity to buy any merchandise related to the game. In advance of these new game and movie releases, though, that has changed. Even if a silly take on Pyramid Head isn't something a fan is interested in, Konami has also revealed other Silent Hill 2 merchandise, like statues, apparel, and even a Dog Ending coin bank.

item.title: 7 RPGs Worth Playing Just For Their Weapon Systems
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • RPG fans seek games with robust weapons: deep crafting, upgrades, and unique tools for engaging gameplay.
  • Witcher 3 offers diverse swords and legendary gear crafting, while Dragon Age: Inquisition brings intricate upgrades.
  • Valhalla and Cyberpunk 2077 focus on tweaking weapons with rare materials, runes, and visual enhancements for player enjoyment.

RPG fans love the genre for many reasons: interesting quests, exploration, character-building, and managing equipment. A robust weapon system can significantly boost player engagement, adding depth and excitement throughout the game. Whether it's offering flexibility in weapon choice, upgrading and modifying weapons extensively, or even crafting players' own deadly tools for specific situations — these are features that many RPG enthusiasts seek when searching for their next game.

For players looking to dive into RPGs with some of the best weapon systems, here are the most notable games from the past decade. These titles stand out for the depth of their weapon mechanics, offering extensive crafting, modifications, and improvements that can take dozens of hours to fully explore and master.

1 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Enormous Selection Of Swords With A Deep Crafting System

CD Projekt Red first introduced weapon crafting in The Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings , but The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt refined and expanded the system to its peak. The Witcher 3 offers dozens of uniquely designed silver and steel swords for Geralt to discover in the open world, while players can also search for legendary Witcher gear schematics to craft some of the game's most powerful weapons. These legendary weapons can be upgraded through several tiers, growing stronger as Geralt progresses, though crafting them requires a significant amount of effort.

First, players must find or purchase legendary schematics, which can be challenging or expensive. Next, they need to locate a master capable of crafting masterwork gear, often tied to specific questlines. Finally, rare and costly components are required for crafting, some of which can be hard to obtain without proper knowledge. Additionally, the Hearts of Stone expansion introduced a new rune system, offering even more depth in weapon customization.

2 Dragon Age: Inquisition

In-Depth Weapon Crafting System With Endless Possibilities

Dragon Age: Inquisition offers one of the most rewarding and intricate weapon systems in any RPG. Almost every weapon in the game can be upgraded with enhanced hafts, pommels, or grips, which can be bought, found, or crafted. Moreover, powerful runes can be added to weapons, granting special perks like extra fire damage or increased damage against dragons.

The real highlight of the game, however, is its deep crafting system for weapons and armor. Many items can be crafted using rare schematics, with players able to choose from various materials to determine the final result. Each material used adds unique properties and aesthetics to the crafted gear, encouraging experimentation. Furthermore, secret merchants are scattered throughout the game, offering rare schematics, weapons, and upgrade materials, rewarding dedicated players with the best resources for crafting their ultimate gear.

3 Assassin's Creed Valhalla

The Best In The Series For Weapon Tweaking

Ubisoft has continually refined its gear and weapon systems in the Assassin's Creed series, and with Valhalla , the studio has delivered one of its best implementations yet. Assassin's Creed Valhalla offers a wide range of weapons to discover and upgrade using common resources, but rarer materials — Carbon, Nickel, and Tungsten Ingots — are essential for unlocking new upgrade tiers and enhancing the appearance of gear with more intricate and exotic designs.

With impressive visual and mechanical upgrade potential, Valhalla also allows players to slot up to three runes into each weapon, granting various effects. These enchantments can add elemental damage types, boost stealth or skill effectiveness, or even provide powerful perks such as knocking enemies down. The Dawn of Ragnarök expansion further expands these possibilities, introducing a new upgrade tier that allows players to forge ultimate Divine weapons using Platinum Ingots.

4 Cyberpunk 2077

Dozens Of Ranged And Melee Weapons To Collect, Craft And Modify

Cyberpunk 2077 follows in The Witcher 3's footsteps, offering a similar weapon management system that includes both melee and ranged weapons of varying rarity, type, and lore. Some of the most powerful weapons in the game can also be crafted, with skills available to boost crafting efficiency and dismantling potential.

Even without diving into crafting, Cyberpunk 2077 's weapon system is extensive. Almost every enemy drops weapons that can be collected, many of which come with modifications that can be removed and reused. Gun dealers also sell weapons, components, and mods, making it worthwhile to check in with them regularly. Plus, the game is packed with unique firearms and melee weapons (like katanas) available in both the base game and the Phantom Liberty expansion.

5 Elden Ring

Biggest Selection Of Upgradeable Weapons Among Soulslike RPGs

Elden Ring , alongside its expansion Shadow of the Erdtree , is widely considered the pinnacle of soulslike RPGs, a status that seems unlikely to change anytime soon. With its enormous world brimming with powerful bosses and countless weapons to discover, the game offers a treasure trove of armaments. While Elden Ring does not feature a traditional weapon crafting system, nearly every weapon can be upgraded to increase damage and improve scaling, but that's just the start.

Many weapons in Elden Ring can also be infused with elemental properties like Fire or Cold, or even altered to deal Holy or Poison damage. Additionally, players have the freedom to switch special weapon skills on most non-legendary weapons, allowing for effortless customization to better tackle specific bosses or challenging situations.

6 Mass Effect: Andromeda

Craft And Experiment With Powerful Weapons In A Sci-Fi Setting

Mass Effect: Andromeda builds upon the crafting foundation set by Dragon Age: Inquisition rather than previous Mass Effect games, offering a deep and engaging weapon crafting system fitting its sci-fi setting. Exploring uncharted worlds allows players to collect rare minerals, which can be used to craft weapons that grow stronger as the game progresses. In addition to crafting, weapon mods provide further opportunities to customize and enhance gear to suit individual playstyles.

One of the standout features of Andromeda is how distinct every weapon feels. The game categorizes guns into three unique types: traditional Milky Way weapons from past Mass Effect games, plasma-based Heleus weapons, and the futuristic beam weapons of the Remnant. Each new acquisition feels exciting, encouraging experimentation to find the perfect fit for every player.

7 Fallout 4

One Of The Best RPGs For Crafting Ranged And Melee Weapons

Fallout 4 offers one of the most flexible and comprehensive crafting systems in RPGs, allowing players to repurpose nearly every piece of scrap they find. Junk can be dismantled for materials, each contributing unique properties when assembling a new weapon. By unlocking special perks, players can enhance the usefulness of crafting even further. With a vast arsenal of both ranged and melee weapons, Fallout 4 enables players to craft a wide variety of gear while utilizing an extensive modification system to alter components such as magazines, scopes, barrels, and more. It's a haven for weapon-crafting enthusiasts.

Alternatively, players can explore Starfield , Bethesda's newer release, which offers a similar depth in crafting, upgrading, and modifying weapons. Ultimately, it comes down to which setting appeals more to the player: the post-apocalyptic world of Fallout or the vast reaches of space in Starfield .

item.title: Gamers Said: What Is Your Favorite JRPG?
item.description:
This week on Gamers Said, We asked gamers what are their favorite Japanese Role Playing Games, and we're educated on what exactly a JRPG is to begin with.

Gamers Said is a weekly look at some of Game Rant's best Threads! We explore what our community has to say on some of the industry hottest questions, as well as give our own opinion on the matter.
